me.alb_i986.selenium.tinafw.config

Class Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.alb_i986.selenium.tinafw.config.Config

  • public class Config
extends Object
    Static class defining a method for each and every configurable setting (aka property) this framework offers.

    It is backed by a PropertyLoader, which hides the low-level details of retrieving properties. This implementation reads properties from the following sources (in the given order):

    1. system properties, defined e.g. as -D arguments to the mvn command
    2. properties files (resources)
      1. custom properties file: "/config.custom.properties"
      2. defaults properties file: "/config.default.properties"

    A property may be:

    • required: if it is not defined, then throw ConfigException
    • optional: if it is not defined, then return null
    • not empty: if it is an empty string, then throw ConfigException

    Clients extending this framework, needing their own configurable settings, should extend this class, and:

    • define one constant for each new configurable setting, with its name
      • optionally, also redefine (aka hide) the constant NAMESPACE with their own namespace
    • define a public static method for each new configurable setting, implementing the retrieval of that setting, which should delegate to getOptionalProperty(String) or getRequiredProperty(String), or to the more generic getProperty(String, boolean), for those properties that are required by some tasks, but may not be so for some other task.
    • optionally, change the logic of how to retrieve properties by redefining propLoader

      • getBrowsers

        public static List<SupportedBrowser> getBrowsers()
        Returns:
        a List of the SupportedBrowser's specified in the property "tinafw.browsers"
        Throws:
        SettingNotFoundException - if the property can't be found,
        ConfigException - if the property is empty
        IllegalArgumentException - if one of the values cannot be converted to SupportedBrowser
        See Also:
        PropertiesUtils.split(String), PropertiesUtils.toSupportedBrowsers(String[])

      • getProperty

        protected static String getProperty(String propertyName,
                                    boolean required)
        Returns:
        getRequiredProperty(String) if required is true; getOptionalProperty(String) otherwise.

      • getRequiredProperty

        protected static String getRequiredProperty(String propertyName)
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property
        Returns:
        the value of the required property (might be an empty string)
        Throws:
        SettingNotFoundException - if the property cannot be found

      • getOptionalProperty

        protected static String getOptionalProperty(String key)
        Load the given property from one of the known sources.

        The order of precedence is as follows:

        1. system properties, defined e.g. as -D arguments to the mvn command
        2. custom properties file, "/config.custom.properties"
        3. defaults properties file, "/config.default.properties"
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property
        Returns:
        the value of the property; null if the property is not found
